page.title: 02STRUCTURE & SCENERY
page.content: {CHALK & FLINT Chalk is the most common rock in the area, you will find it almost everywhere. Broughton Downs are made out of chalk, it has some flint in it as well, and where the chalk has been eroded away the hard flints are left behind mixed with clay. Chalk flint and clay (made into bricks) are used in the buildings in Broughton. {THE WALLOP BROOK} The Wallop Brook is quite a clean river, it not polluted. It runs for about five miles until it joins the Test at Kimbridge. The brook has quite a few fish in it, and people fish and swim in the clear, deep pools. Because the stream runs over chalk its level drops with the water table; last summer and autumn (1984) it was dry for several months.
